column5: My buddy sent me a picture he took this morning at his cottage, the patio table is 1 night of snow, he said he cleared the rest of the deck last night when he arrived at 2:00 am and left the patio table untouched  he is stuck up there until snow plows come through , luck guy .... wood stove, beer and hockey night in Canada, what else do ya need
As a kid when we'd spend a Christmas at the cottage, after dad shoveled the roof, we'd toboggan off the roof onto the piles below!
"he is stuck up there until snow plows come through , luck guy .... wood stove, beer and hockey night in Canada, what else do ya need"    Ummm.. his girlfriend
Ummm.. his girlfriend  after 25 years of marriage ....... maybe he has a girlfriend up there and didn't tell me
We used to make wads of cash clearing off cottage roofs up in Haliburton, decades back, when fewer people were as eager to open their cottages in winter.
Just cant imagine the size of the Salmon that marshy would catch
Many older people with head problems...true or false  Jokin lol, sounds like fun
This wouldn't happen to involve a wooden spoon in your wifes hand while you were in the kitchen, would it?
My kid brother jumped off the roof thinking the snow would cushion the fall. It was messy

Hey, I resemble that remark!  (Still in my 30's, so not too old by some standards  )   Ouch.  There was so much snow then, that their was really only like a 4 ft drop to the top of the pile below. Lots of fun!...no injuries

My deck looks a bit like that, except you can't see the table anymore, and the snow is up to the top of the deck railing.  We went from virtually no snow on Tuesday, to head-high snowbanks yesterday morning. It is definitely going to slow the ice down, with no really cold nights forecast in the next few days.

The Mrs. and I are heading up to Yonges Point, north of Peterboro in an hour, sure hope the snow conditions are better there than Haliburton & surrounding areas.  Parka, boots, bags of salt & shovel are already packed though......just in case

You should be OK Lew...  We only got about 8 to 10 inches the past few days...  Minden and Bancroft sure got hit hard...The pics on CHEX TV last night were awesome...  One OPP officer was up to his shoulders trying to dig out the cruiser...
You won't have any problems, we don't have near that kinda snow around here, and the lakes are just starting to freeze up nicely...with no snow on top.
Thanks Beans & Jer, I appreciate the updates.
